steps.text: Welcome to Internet of Pings! Explore various example scenarios here, illustrating network construction, data transmission processes, and practical applications in real-life settings.

The concept of connecting the internet to retro-future invokes a fascinating juxtaposition of the past and the future, intertwining nostalgia with innovation. In the digital age, where advancements in technology propel us forward at an unprecedented pace, there's a yearning to revisit the simplicity and charm of bygone eras. By bridging the internet with retro-future themes, we evoke a sense of wonder and curiosity, exploring how the technologies of yesterday influence and shape the digital landscapes of tomorrow. It's a journey that invites us to reflect on the evolution of communication, envisioning a future that draws inspiration from the aesthetics and ideals of the past while leveraging the cutting-edge capabilities of modern connectivity.
Consider the challenge of navigating a dark room to locate your friend without the aid of calling out their name. It's undoubtedly a daunting task, isn't it?
Networks face a similar challenge! Hosts struggle to locate other hosts without employing a comparable method.

To simulate this scenario, note the presence of two hosts on the grid. Switch to the "Node" tab and initiate a ping to the respective host. You will notice that the host now sends a packet to the destination host to get the needed information.
